reviews.text: Unprofessional staff, noisy, could not turn down air conditioning, took several calls to solve noise problem, would not allow late departure even though hotel was empty until moving up time we would leave when asked twice only to call later in the morning to say we should have checked out. by now. Don't try to contact the hotel after staying at hotel as they also have problems with customer service online also. Then speaking to manager tells you one thing then does something else.
reviews.title: Waste of Money

reviews.text: We came up for a hockey tournament, so really had no choice in where we stayed, when we first checked in my husband forgot his credit card at home in the states so we put it on my bank card well aparently the girl behind the desk was confused and charged it 400.00 off the bat, we get home I check my bank statement low and behold there are 7 different charges from this hotel totaling 1,800.00 (for two nights) I called 6 times and the manager Joanne NEVER called me back till I made a complaint to the corprate office.. Then all of a sudden a new charge came up claiming they found evidence we smoked in our room (yeah too bad we don't smoke at all) for 250.00 (this was after the complaint aginst her was filed) so I told her it was crap and I was again going over her head now all of a sudden oh it may have been the wrong room let me double check that was yesterday still no call back and almost a week later still no refund to our bank account!! Oh yeah our TV was broken and the AC would not turn off we complained about that but no one cared enough to fix it..
reviews.title: Better hope you don't have a billing issue.

reviews.text: Stayed here early April 2009 as part of a group of families attending a sports tournament in Hamilton. It was pricier than we normally pay for a tournament hotel, so I suppose I was expecting a bit more ... but it wasn't anything special. It is easy to find which is good and centrally located, which is also good ... the parking lot, however, takes quite the navigational skills to work! The beds were comfortable and the internet worked fine, and everything seemed clean. The housekeeping staff was pleasant and polite. There is no room service (except for a very expensive morning breakfast) so we had to run out at nice to find a pizza place close by and the elevators were painfully slow. However, check-in and out was smooth and pleasant. The bathrooms were tiny! Our biggest complaint though, and I would caution anyone else staying here - we had a room facing the main (King) street. It was so loud we could hear everything on the street at night. To make matters even worse, the curtains did not close so our room did not get dark at all - we got the lights and sounds from the street all night ... it did not make for a restful sleep even though the beds were comfortable.
reviews.title: All-in-all it was OK but don't get a room facing the street

reviews.text: When we arrived it was past 9 pm and we had to catch a flight the next morning, so it was a brief stay. The hotel is beautiful! The rooms are out of a magazine, with new queen size beds and wide screen tv's. The bedding was fresh and pristine and the pillows were plentiful. We had a beautiful view of the harbour and were able to settle in quickly.

reviews.text: *Note to anyone staying there - You have to go down the stairs, and as soon as you hit parking level two, you have to change staircases, (if I remember right) there should be a unmarked, unlocked door on the way to parking - take that and you'll find the carpeted staircase - otherwise if you continue down, there is no door for the lobby - you end at the basement door, which is alarmed. So, you have to go back up. And trapse around the hotel trying to find a way out - to me, that is a Health and Safety hazard.
